review: Night one: Shaky legs at first, but slept through out the night.   I have pelvic floor disorder.  I will take it as needed.  Still little bit of urine each time I pee at times, but to have not as much bladder pressure during the day and slept throughout the night was so thankful.  Saw stars when bent down in morning, probably affecting my blood pressure. Took it around 10:15pm was up since 5:40am for work.  I feel it’s a miracle drug because I was so miserable before with the CONSTANT BLADDER PRESSURE and WAKING UP to not COMPLETELY empty my bladder.  So far side affects are feeling tired, shaky legs, and seeing stars (low blood pressure).  I couldn’t stand my constant waking up and bladder pressure so I took medicine which I normally don’t do cause of side effects.This is a REAL review.  To notice improvement in just one dose 5mg, seems amazing.  I was hugely constipated, but there’s always fleet enemas, although not sure if you can take with this medicine?

My husband took these tablets for 3 days from 2/9/21 to 4/9/21 and found he couldn’t even walk to the end of his garden by the 3rd day. His acid reflux was worse and found he couldn’t even keep food down as it was getting stuck in his oesophagus. On October 1st he was diagnosed with cancer, Wouldn’t recommend these tablets.
VESIcare (solifenacin):After a week+ of taking the tablets, made no difference to my constant peeing! I suspect if I carry on with them no change. Side effects dry mouth & throat, stomach aches.

Lying here with the worst back pain ever, sharp pain in lower back. My eyes have been really blurry today , and an odd empty feeling in the pit of my tum. And that's after four 5ml tablets over four days.  I am not going to take anymore.

So disappointed was on solifenacin for three months but the heartburn was getting it several times a day altered my bowels harder to go also gave me dry mouth and cough and worse awful tired helped my trips in night just wish not so many side effects could cope with dry mouth but not the others

After taking solifenacin for just a few days my nighttime trips to the toilet reduced to 3 times when previously it had been as many as 6 times. I hope it will reduce those trips even further. The only negative effect has been slight constipation, easily put right by prunes.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Didn't work. Only gave me a dry mouth.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Vesicare was effective at controlling bladder spasms. I experienced very dry mouth, constipation, blurred vision.
This is the best tablets ever ! Used to get up to go to the toilet every hour, go once now and I don't keep getting that urge to go in the day time no more !!

VESIcare (solifenacin):Worst medication I've probably ever had! Was only on it for about 11 days, and started to get urinary retention - so decided with my doctor to stop it. Once I stopped it, a couple of days later I had the worse overactive bladder symptoms I've ever had. Was up till 5 in the morning just peeing every 5 minutes for hours! Which obviously made me very dehydrated and anxious. I'm thinking it must have been my system trying to clear out the meds or something! I know it's different for everyone, but I would deffo recommend an alternative medication, or check out posterior nerve stimulation which is potentionally more of a long term solution rather than taking meds! I have been referred by my doctor for this so just waiting now!

I'm an otherwise healthy 24 year old. I've always gone to the bathroom to pee a little more than most people but about 2 weeks ago I started feeling like I ALWAYS needed to go, even right after peeing. After being tested for infections and given a bladder/kidney ultrasound my urologist prescribed me this. After 4 doses I feel almost completely normal. Side effects: dry eyes, dry mouth, slight dizziness at first. Worth it in my opinion!

Started taking Vesicare in March 2019 (Brand name).  After a few weeks it started helping a lot.  My urge to go subsided and life was almost normal again.  When Generic version was released, my pharmacy filled it as Generic.  Took Generic for a month and a half and I was right back where I started... constant urge to go.  Went back on brand name and all was well again... until my insurance stopped paying anything for the brand name because a generic is available.  Over $400 a month for 30 pills!  Trying a Generic from a different manufacturer now and hoping it's better than the first one I tried.   No relief yet but still hoping.   Rating below is for GENERIC.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Started with 5mg dose of Vesicare, later on, jumped on 10mg dose to help with peeing problems. In the beginning, it helped a lot, but after a few months my body got used to it and now problems are coming back. So overall it does the job, but unfortunately, the effect is temporary.

VESIcare (solifenacin):My side effects from vesicare are constipation, dry mouth, dizziness, sore throat, itching burning.  I have some reduction in urinary  frequency but not enough to justify side effects.   Took for 35 days
Just got this medicine solifenacin today and I feel like a new person. I thought I’d never get out of that bathroom!!! My mouth is dry and I feel a little tired but that’s fine!! Miracle drug

VESIcare (solifenacin):Took Vesicare 5mg for 6 days. Side effects were terrible. Dizziness, dry mouth, blurred vision, coughing, burning on urinating and worst of all crippling chest pains. Felt like I was going to peg out! Stopped taking the tablet immediately and it took 3 days to get back to normal. Off to see the GP again to see if there is anything else I can try.

I've tried Solifenacen Succinate 5mg twice to take the generic over the expensive Vesicare and it just does not work like Vesicare.  I was willing to absorb the cost of the more expensive Vesicare myself but then my Pharmacy advised me the cost of Vesicare skyrocketed again.

Been on a solifenecin for two years following prostate operation.  A recent an eye sight test showed what looks like starburst behind my eye suggesting  high blood pressure. GP ordered me to stop taking the 'tablets' and although only a week in my blood pressure is slowly but surely  returning to something like an 'acceptable' level.

I was prescribed this drug for overactive bladder, after a urolift procedure. It was completely ineffective and caused more problems than it solved. The main problem being constipation. And with being constipated and pressing on the bladder, it was making the OAB worse. Discontinued the drug, but it has a long half life of 48 hours and took 2 days to clear the system. Found ciprofloxin to treat and underlying infection and a stool softner much more effective. I certainly would't recommend it.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I've been struggling with nocturia and an overactive bladder for years. I've been taking vesicare 5 mg for two months after it was prescribed for me by a urologist here in Iraq. No side effects at all. The drug is working and helping me a lot, but slowly, and some OAB symptoms are still there at the night, but they are greatly reduced. I can now sleep much better than before. Vesicare is very good and effective but it takes some time to kick in.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Had overactive bladder for sometime. VESIcare 5mg really helped this. Unfortunately I’ve had to discontinue as caused the most awful dry mouth and throat. After around 2 months on the VESIcare I got a bad sore throat and initially thought it was an unrelated infection. My throat, mouth and tongue then got red sore patches and ulcers. I can only think the VESIcare is to blame because it completely dried out my mouth and throat. Stopped the medication 3 days ago on the advice of my Doctor. I have a relative on this medication and she is absolutely fine on it. So - different for everyone

VESIcare (solifenacin):I took this for 13 days, it did seem to help with the incontinence somewhat but the side effects are horrible.  Severe dizziness,  blurry vision,  eye pain/headache and eye dryness, heartburn  (something I have never had) , extreme tiredness,  muscle aches and confusion.I have been off the medication for 3 days, some of the side effects have stopped but the aching and dizziness are still a problem. I wonder how long they will take to go away.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Vesicare.After a short time experiencedVery dry mouth, dry eyes.Very tired, muscle aches.It did have a positive effect but the side effects outweighed the benefit.
VESIcare (solifenacin):I noticed slight improvement over the first couple months. After 6 months I now sleep 4-5 hours without my bladder waking me. Changed my life. Very expensive.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have had OAB for a couple of years now. I am 65 and am getting up 3-5 times a night.(this is my BIGGEST complaint)I do not leak . This I am thankful for .I was prescribed Mirabegron and took it for 6 wks and had side effects worse than I wanted. I went off it and my urologist prescribed Vesicare. I am reluctant to try this after reading the side effects that come with this medication.I am thinking just living with this is better than the horrible side effects. Wish there was a natural cure. Again the BIG PHARM making lots of money. thanks for everyones' comments. Even if some people feel it was helpful I think for most people it isn't worth it. OR, at least for me. I do not have to even pay a lot for any of these meds ( thanks to our wonderful medicare in Ont Canada). and still don't think I will even try this.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I took Vedicare for 4 months. Vesicare did improve my overactive bladder and the urinary urge did decrease. I did not immediately experience side effects except some constipation and reduced stool frequency. I also started getting full nights of sleep without waking to use the loo. That’s the positive part....After 2 months i started getting occasional liquid diarrhea and then bouts of constipation lasting 3-4 days, then again liquid diarrhea. Throughout this time lots of gas and cramping. The symptoms were on-off.Then after 3 months I experienced continuous liquid diarrhea and gas/cramping after every meal. During the space of 30 days I lost over 5kg in weight, and had fatigue and very cold feet and hands.I stopped Vesicare immediately and normal bowel movements restored with 5 days. The fatigue and cold extremities have gone also.My conclusions: the Vesicare drug works but the side effects are intolerable on a significant portion of patients including myself.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Vesicare 10 mg is the only med that helped me control my OAB however at the price of $544 for 90 day supply I just couldn't afford to keep up with it. Will try those Botox injections as a last resort. So sad that I cannot afford my meds.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Please be very careful taking this drug and monitor your blood pressure.  I took Vesicare twelve years ago (for about five years) 5mg.  It really helped by OAB.  I stopped as symptoms went away.  Recently had bad UTI,  and after infection was over, I was left with residual frequency, pain, urethra burning.  Tried Vesicare again 5mg and immediately felt my blood pressure increasing during the day.  Middle of the night had to be taken to ER.  BP was 197/120 and heart rate 130.ER confirmed that Vesicare was culprit.  I was able to handle the drug in my 30s but now that I am close to 50 it did not work with my body.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Since December of 2017 I began to experience IC like symptoms. As my symptoms continue to get worse about 3 weeks ago I ended up in the ER due to a horrible flare up. After a pointless night in the ER, the doctor prescribed me this medication to help with my bladder spasms. Before taking this medication I would have a flare up 1-2 times a week and NEVER daily. Coincidentally, as soon as I began to take this medication I began to experience flare ups daily. These flare ups were HORRIBLE flare ups and worse than I have ever felt before. I blame it on this medication since it is the only "new" thing right now. I put two and two together and got off the medicine after a few weeks of consumption. My flare ups have subsided in pain significantly but are still occurring more often than usual. I do not recommend this medication and think it is one that is worth skipping over.
VESIcare (solifenacin):This is garbage. I'll go back to taking the oxybutinin.
VESIcare (solifenacin):This only relieved symptoms very little ..still had to wear pad everyday and very expensive

VESIcare (solifenacin):Had severe urge incontinence for 6 years before seeking help. Was put on Ditropan, then Mirbetriq, both of which helped for about 4 months, then stopped working. Dr. then put me on Vesicare 10 mg which caused SEVERE dry throat and mouth, hoarseness, and sores on tongue due to dryness. With reduction to 5 mg, I've been almost totally continent with no side effects for about 6 months. I hope it keeps on working.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have been struggling with Urinary urgency and leakage for at least a year. I finally gave in and saw a Urologist. Just 1 pill gave me the relief I needed. I am so grateful! The only side effect is dry mouth. It is well worth it! Just 5 mg. once daily has been my dose. What a great product! Thank you! Now I can get on with my life!

VESIcare (solifenacin):My bladder weakness was so bad that sometimes I would literally wet myself if I needed to go. I had no control at all! I had to wear pads all the time. I went to the drs who at first suggested things like cutting out caffeine which irritates the bladder. This did help but I still had no control! I was prescribed vesicare 5mg and after about 3 days WOW! I no longer need a pad, I am able to hold on to my urine even if I am desperate! I occasionally forget to take one or 2 and I can tell the difference straight away as I lose control again! Amazing little pill!

VESIcare (solifenacin):I've been on this medication for one week (10mg) and have found it to work quite well. I'm not running to the bathroom constantly and I am able to hold my urine until I can get there when I do have to go. I am experiencing dry mouth, which I hope will go away, and I have been a little drowsy but neither of these side effects are unmanageable. I started taking Metamucil 2x daily and have not been constipated yet. I will keep taking it but may try cutting the pills in half to make the prescription last longer (expensive!)

VESIcare (solifenacin):Besides the high cost, the effectiveness of this medication is diminished, due to the side effects. I started on this medication for nine days and stopped. Constipation was the primary side effect almost at the first day, the worst I ever had, in addition to abdominal pain, slight headache and bloating. My Doctor did warn me about the side effects.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Poor results, I have no positive results, especially at the highway robbery price of this drug ($1100.00) cash price for 3 months
VESIcare (solifenacin):VESIcare did nothing for me.

VESIcare (solifenacin):My bladder was out of control ! Having to urinate almost every 45 min to an hour. Seriously, I was going 25-30 times a day. It was awful. The Dr put me on Vesicare 5mg. It worked great from the 2-3 day..however after a week or so my symptoms came back. He decided to put me on the 10 mg. At first my mouth and eyes were very dry, I almost stopped taking it. I decided to give it some time and see what happened. The drug was a life saver for me, the dry mouth and eyes went away after the 2nd week. Constipation was kind of an issue but I started using Miralax and had no problems at all. Well that is until about 3-4 weeks of taking the 10 mg....It seems as though my symptoms are coming back.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have suffered from incontinence and over active bladder for many years and put up with it. I was prescribed a 5mg dose from the hospital doctor and although it didn't help with incontinence, it did help with a better urination flow and less frequent visits to the toilet, they upped the dose to 10 by the physiotherapist I was seeing about an overactive bladder and incontinence. I have had bad side effects of, pebble constipation, feeling very unwell with stuffed up nose, sore throat, very tired, stomach upset including acid, chest pain and have now had the meds stopped by my GP as it could be causing my blood pressure to drop. I was really happy in the beginning with the benefits of the vesicare medication but the bad outweighs the good.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have an overactive bladder. My urologist prescribed Vesicare in 5 mg and 10. I thought it was working fine until I had severe pains in my chest. I went to the ER today and they could not find any cardiac issues so they are keeping me overnight for observation. Not sure if it is the drug or something else. Don't think I will be using it in the future.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I took this meds within 3 days I had extreme headache, left arm was numb, woke up to my body feeling hot. I started feeling spasm in my lower left bottom and leg. Pain in my left leg and flu like symptoms.

VESIcare (solifenacin):After 5 days taking vesicare I feel like I have the flu. My throat is sore, my mouth is dry, vision is blurry and my stomach is upset. I was prescribed 10's. I am stopping them today. I also am having trouble emptying my bladder. I won't take this again.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Have taken 5  Vesicare and I can only say I have become housebound.  The side effectts have been horendous.  Visual disturbances,  dizzy, blinding head pains, totally confused.  I live alone and need to go to the shops but can't drive in this state.  CN anyone tell me now long these side effects will last.  Was going to try to give it a week but dont know if I can last that long .Help.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I've tried a few different medications for oab......nothing really helped until I tried vesicare.....it's been a godsend for me what a difference to my everday life my life doesn't evolve around the loo anymore have switched to decaffeinated coffee also which doctor advised me

VESIcare (solifenacin):I was pleased with the results (Doctor samples) but, when I got a prescription, I was flabbergasted by the price.  Average cost for 5mg is over $300.00. None of my current 3 month supplies are anywhere near this price. I would have to increase my Medicare plan to a 4 tier plan which would cost an additional $99.00 per month......no savings there. No thanks.......I cannot fathom why the pharmacuetical companies charge so much or how they get away with it.

VESIcare (solifenacin):This medication changed my life! I started taking it at age 72. Before then, I thought I was going to have to be housebound, never traveling, never shopping, etc. I started taking the smaller dose and it is working just fine. My only side effect is dry mouth at night but discovered that if I wake up with it, I suck on an ACT lozenge, which immediately alleviates the problem.  I did discover through reading the info on this page that it is probably the cause of mild indigestion I've had, probably starting about the time I started taking Vesicare, but I take a Zantac a day and am fine. Oh, the medication started working almost immediately.I would hate to be without my Vesicare, even though it is quite expensive. But it's worth every penny.

VESIcare (solifenacin):It was helping with the frequency l still have bad days. Started it in March 16.I also have a problem with constipation. I don't eat or drink enough have lost 2 and a half stone. As I live in the UK I don't have to pay full price just a prescription  charge. I find I have become obsessed and anxious about it not continuing to give me some relief. I will be going back to the doctors for more help with distressing condition.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Found myself getting up 4-8 times a day and needing the toilet alot during the day. First prescribed 5mg and it done absolutely nothing so the doctor uped them to 10mg and still nothing except constipation. So ive stopped them and will just have to deal with it.

3 days in on 10mg per day, bloodshot, dry and sore eyes, vision problems, dry mouth, severe headaches, nausea, constipation, flu like symptoms, helped with frequency but I'd rather pee every 1/2 hour than feel like this:((

VESIcare (solifenacin):I initially thought this medication might work. I woke up only 2-3 times each night for the first week and during the day felt I had a bit more control over my bladder. I now think that was merely wishful thinking. Last night (day 5 on the medication), I was up FIVE times. In addition, I have experienced weight gain of 3 pounds and in spite of REALLY wanting it to work, I am still having urge incontinance.   This medication is garbage and the manufacturers are laughing all the way to bank. Over $1000.00 for a 3 month supply ($90.00 after insurance)and I am willing to toss it in the trash. That's what I think about Vesicare.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Amazing results bladder wise. No more rushing to the toilet for fear of wetting. Dry throat for the first two months but better now. Worst problem is uncontrollable weight gain. This is frustrating as I have a heathy diet. My doctor doesn't seem to offer any help.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I'm 21 and recently started taking VESIcare, at first it was 10mg but i literally could not poop i would go 2-3 days without pooping and had severe heartburn. My doctor lowered it to 5mg and it helps a bit with the urinating but i do notice in situations where i'm stressed it doesn't seem to work as well but when i'm relaxed its perfectly fine. Also, with the 5mg i'm still having constipation and only poop about every other day and i'm still having bad heartburn every few weeks or so. I'm not sure if i want to stick with this medication or not because i should not be having this bad of heartburn at 21.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Took this medication for two weeks.  Did nothing in reducing OAB.  Had horrible reaction of severe DROWSINESS!   Was so bad I almost went to sleep in traffic a couple of times before I realized what was causing me to feel that way.  Lost all my energy and gumption to get anything done.  Just wanted to sleep.  Then week two I got to where when I went to the restroom, I would just sit there.  I could not start a flow without thinking about it for what seemed like five minutes.  I stopped taking and called my doctor.  Calling in another medication to try.  I pray it works without all the side effects!

VESIcare (solifenacin):I started on a low dose 5mg of Vesicare for OAB.  Worked by third dose.  Its working really well for me, no more accidents, no side effects.  I take mine with dinner as the evening was when I was up and down to the toilet, which was difficult as I have Rheumatoid arthritits and by the evening I don't want to be getting up and down and can not do so quickly.  Also my Goldie dog tends to somehow always be laying in the wrong place when I'm in a hurry LOL.  I notice it can make you drowsy and I have been sleeping really well and thats not because of not having to get up at night when in bed as that wasn't much of a problem anyway.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Rubbish! It did absolutely nothing...

VESIcare (solifenacin):I am a 38 year old female diagnosed with MSK, Overactive Bladder and Stomach Ulcers. I've been prescribed Vesicare and have been taking it for a few weeks. I have noticed that I'm not getting up as much at night but I still sometimes have to run to the restroom during the day. My concerns after taking this med is I'm not feeling like myself. And after reading the side effects I have noticed that I'm experiencing everything listed literally. I'm also afraid it may be interacting with my other meds. This medication is expensive also, don't think I should continue to use it especially since I'll have to take it for the remainder of my life. Continuing on my search for relief.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I had a urinary tract infection and the doctor ordered it to help me urinate less until the antibiotics kicked in. It probably did help for that but generally I haven't seen a big difference. I would say that I am about the same as I usually am. The first time I took it was in the evening and I was extremely tired and wanted to sleep around 8pm )I usually only go to bed/sleep around midnight. Yesterday I was completely zonked. I slept for most of the day. Last night I was looking online on my phone and was searching can a UTI make you tired and came across this site. I realized that my vision is blurry (I thought it was just being over tired) and that it can cause "fatique". I hadn't put these down to side effects. I am stopping immediately
Been on vesicare for 3 months but now terrible constipation. Has anyone tried taking a dose every second day. Was the drug still effective?

VESIcare (solifenacin):My experience with this drug wasn't pleasant. I got completely blocked after 5 days of taking the pills and was unable to do both number 1 and 2. Even my period was late, which does not normally happen. I ended up in an emergency room with severe stomach pains. The other side effects such as lack of concentration, tiredness and headache were easy to deal with, it is just a matter of getting used to them. I would have stayed on those pills because I felt less need to urine than I used to, which finally has given me a relief, however I had no other choice then stop taking them, and take pills to help me move the urine and bowel motion out of my body.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I am a 33 year old female with overactive bladder.  Vesicare is the only medication that has literally fixed the problem.  I didn't realize how bad my bladder problem was until I started taking it and realizing that I didn't have to get up 3-5 times at night and I didn't have that constant pinching in my bladder anymore.  Now the problem is I can't afford Vesicare.  I tried using that momentum program they have and that helped bring the price down, but my insurance company changed and now they want me to pay $210 a month.  I just can't afford it.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have PPMS/Multiple Sclerosis and have been on .5mg for 2 years, has helped considerably, yes some dry mouth but drink more water. I'm a 54 year old male, and with MS I cannot honestly tell you that I have less or more joint pain as this is what MS is all about, but wetting my pants was no fun! I really can't complain much about side affect's but would like to try to try every other day. Oh, and I still can get an erection! Just need a wife to help on that one!

VESIcare (solifenacin):I've taken Vesicare for 3 weeks now and my overactive bladder has improved significantly. Before I was back and forth to the bathroom all day at work and nights were the worst. 5 to 6 times throughout the night had my life completly messed up. So far I think I've only experienced dry mouth and I'm hoping that's all I experience because this medicine has changed my life.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Been having cold like symptoms. Running nose, sneezing, stomach pain, constipation, heart beating too fast. I've been taken only 4 days but stopped today. Side effects are too much and they're making me miserable.

VESIcare (solifenacin):This is my third time on vesicare. After seeing several doctors with symptoms of UTIs and having pathology determine there was no infection I was diagnosed with urethral syndrome. I usually take 5mg per day and the condition clears up within a week and I can stop the medication. No more tenderness, spasms or urgency. Some dry mouth, but that's easily solved.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I started Vesicare 3 weeks ago. I did help me a little for my overactive bladder but my eyesight is getting very blurry. Also my myopia is worsening. I can read a book without my reading glasses now, so my myopia is worsened by -1. I am going to stop taking it and hope for my eyesight to return to normal.

VESIcare (solifenacin):This medication initially was very helpful in helping me get my urinary problems under control. During the first month of treatment, it caused extreme dry mouth and dry eyes. By week six,it caused heartburn and upset stomach. At first, I did not make the connection between the drug and my symptoms, but after thinking about it, the possibility of Vesicare being the culprit became very real to me.. I used this website to confirm my suspicions. I have decided to inform my doctor and curtail daily usage, less things get worse.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Caused dry mouth, headaches, weight gain and pain in lower back.  Now seeing a physio as my back hurts so much.   I'm on 10mg a day.   Within one month running to the toilet was normalised and I slept all night without needing to get up numerous times.   Someone else mentioned affect on eye sight.  I have experienced this too but hadn't thought to link it to the drugs.

VESIcare (solifenacin):This is my second day on Veslcare.  I will not take it another day.  My throat and tongue are on fire and I feel very nervous and anxious.  The first day it did help my overactive bladder, but the side effects are not worth the benefit.  This was a sample from my doctor so I'm glad I didn't have to pay for it.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Taking 1/2 a 5 mg tablet which has reduced the number of times I needed to go to toilet.I find that vesicare causes blurry vision, memory. Some memory problems and dry mouth. I take Movicol am and pm ( laxative)  and Biotene for dry mouth and also feel somewhat tired and lack motivation. I hope in 3 month when I trial not taking it for 2 weeks will work as the side effects and the price of tablets make me short tempered.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I love this. I don't go all the time and the flow is strong. I had dry mouth in the beginning but that is subsiding. I don't have any other side effects. It feels great to sleep through the night without going. I feel normal again.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Have been on Vesicare for 3 or 4 years now and am on 10mg a day. I remember the doctor saying that dry mouth can be a side effect but now after reading all these comments about constipation and pain etc I'm a little concerned that she never warned me about these, although I have never experienced these if I had done I would have not connected it to being a side effect from the medication. I notice that if I stop taking it for a week or so things get bad and I have no control whatsoever. I feel like I will be on this medication for a very very long time but I guess its worth it. Even though I am taking 10mg a day I still go toilet a lot but I have some control back which is great, people still comment on the amount of times I go toilet.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I started taking this medication and within a few days I noticed the bottom of my feet were getting sensations like air bubbles. At first that did not bother me but then it turned painful. As soon as I stopped the bubbles were less intense and went away after a few more days. The accidents I had were still there. I did not seem to have any effect on the frequency either.

Suffered urge incontinence for over 40 years. Now 77. Pelvic floor exercises as advised by G.P. did not work and incontinence (mild) and frequency especially at night was an increasing problem. Saw consultant who prescribed Solifenacin and the improvement after a month is good- get up once a night instead of 3-4 times so sleep better. Problem is side effects! Dry mouth and nasal passage not really a problem but blurred vision and  being dazzled by bright sun, car headlights when driving, plus some cognitive deterioration and constipation is proving a bit of a worry. Not sure if I will carry on long term.

VESIcare (solifenacin):My doctor wanted me to switch from Detrol LA to Vesicare to see if it controlled overactive bladder better. For a couple of days, it seemed to. I was going less often and the flow was strong. Then the Vesicare started irritating my prostate and I felt discomfort and/or burning much of the time. I took an OTC painkiller to ease that, and it helped somewhat. Then, after about 2 weeks' use, I started getting mild headaches and severe neck pain. It felt as though I had been bitten by a wasp, but the pain didn't subside like an insect bite. The pain was in the nerves, not deep in the muscle. I also developed dry mouth early on. I am stopping taking the Vesicare and will return to the Detrol LA, which never caused a problem.
VESIcare (solifenacin):I have been taking them for 5 days, no results problem same as it is.

I have had an Overactive bladder for my whole life. This medicine is the only one that has helped me, and I have had zero side effects from it. I have been taking this for 5 years now. No issues. Still on the 5mg dose.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Taking Vesicare for overactive bladder and bladder irritation. I have been on this for over one year. It helped somewhat for the overactive bladder and irritation. Makes my mouth very dry and blurred my vision pretty bad. I don't know if I will continue this medication as I do not think the side effects are worth it. Also made me BLOATED.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I am only 26 and was going to the bathroom every hour, and sometimes every half an hour during the day. I took Vesicare for 7 months and saw a decent decrease in the amount of trips to the bathroom. However, I was often constipated, bloated, had a headache, and experienced a change in eye prescription. I stopped taking the medication and switched to another. It took 6 months before my eye prescription stabilized to where it had originally been before Vesicare.

I have been prescribed solfenacin for overactive bladder but within 2 days I was constipated. I kept up the dose while trying to alleviate the bowel problem. Eventually I stopped the solfenacin after 4 days dosing and then 3 days after that my bowel responded, after it had been helped with natural stimulants such as prunes & liquorice. Solfenacin has a long half life so I think I have now resumed dosage but will take 2 on 2 successive days then another 3 days later. The OAB was not excessively bad so I will see how it responds before my next visit to the specialist & whether the night trip/s to the toilet becomes a thing of the past.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Took this medicine along with Uroxatral for slow stream and urinary frequency, both secondary to radiation cystitis caused by brachytherapy.  Vesicare caused slight mouth dryness at 5mg, severe mouth dryness and bad taste at 10mg.
VESIcare (solifenacin):I took one dosage, and it made me ill.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I am a male with overactive bladder. Initially treated for prostrate problem, as usual for men, but I have no prostrate difficulty. Asked Dr. for Vesicare, afrter reviewing symptoms on internet sources. Vesicare is targeted at women by the drug co. Astellas, but I had the same symtoms. Started with the 5mg dose, and my symtoms significantly improved within first few days. Severe bathroom urges every hour or two. Woke up to pee several times at night, sometimes every 2 hours; miss a bathroom, and pee in pants. A week later after starting Vesicare, get up once a night, or not at all, and bathroom visits are once in 3-5 hours. Wow, got my life back. Only nasty side effect is constipation, cured by taking pill less frequently than daily.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Over the past few years I have tried all the medication for a overactive bladder that is available through my doctors. This medication for me is the best one, it works really well and I have no symptoms of an overactive bladder and helps with my bladder leaking. The only reason I did not give it 10/10 is the side effects dry mouth, thirst, and I do feel very tired when taking this tablet.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I am a 27 year old female. I started noticing that I was going to the bathroom on average 12 times a day. I was losing sleep because I would get up 2 or 3 times a night, at work I was constantly running to the bathroom what seemed like every hour. I went to my obgyn who gave me a test and started me on 10mg of Vesicare. Within the first day I saw instant results. I have been taking it for over a month and about 2weeks ago I started to have severe abdominal pains, constipation and lower back pains, as well as light colored poop. I lowered my dosage to 5mg and everything seemed to get better until today. Same severe side effects again. I had to stop taking it.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have been on different medications for the past year to treat overactive bladder. I would also be unable to make it to the toilet before I needed to empty my bladder. I have been on Vesicare for 3 days. Fantastic, I cannot believe the difference. No more embarrassing moments, I am dry all day and night. I can make it to the toilet in time. I am no longer waking up throughout the night needing the toilet. No side effects also which I found with all the other medication I have tried. I was considering surgery but I don't think i will need to have surgery now.
VESIcare (solifenacin):This worked great for me in regards to my overactive bladder. Sadly, it also made me feel like I had a urinary tract infection most of the time. NOT a good feeling.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Little positive results.  Caused excessive dry mouth and markedly reduced ejaculate.
VESIcare (solifenacin):5mg is not effective  10mg is too strong   I would like a 7+mg tablet

VESIcare (solifenacin):It worked with taking another overactive bladder medicine.  But eventually I experienced severe fatigue, blurred vision, weight gain and mostly it caused me intimacy problems.  I discontinued it, got it all back.
VESIcare (solifenacin):I have been on this for about a month but I am needing the toilet more often and it is maaking it hard for me to go, I also find it makes me very tired.

VESIcare (solifenacin):The relief from 'leakage' was moderate to good, but I continued to have to use feminine hygiene pads.  I was 'down' to six changes a day, which was a real improvement.  However, I had no idea what real constipation was about and how severe it could be until Vesicare. All in all, the cost/benefit ratio just wasn't there. Speaking of cost, the price was outrageous.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Worked for a month then now symptons returning.  I have also suffered from a lack of appetite and have put weight on although no-one else has mentioned this.
VESIcare (solifenacin):I think it works great. Only been on it for over a week and is helping.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Effective at stopping bladder pain but suffered very bad oral and nasal dryness so had to stop. Also suggest try not to drink alcohol for bladder pain.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I got positive results after the first tablet.  I stayed with the medication for two weeks but had to discontinue use due to constipation.  In fact the constipation was so bad in the second week I was giving myself enemas to get relief.

VESIcare (solifenacin):Product works great, however I did experience some side effects, especially when I first started taking it, nothing that wasn't in the information though.I had fairly severe pain in my chest similar to heartburn pain; but this went away over time, and I only occasionally experience minor now (been on it for a year).  I also did experience a little blurred vision at first, but again it has gone away.As I am only 43 years old, my doctor I might be able to take it for a few months then stop, but that didn't work, had to go back on it again.Now I take it every other day, which is about 95% effective, but to me worth the trade off of not taking so much medication at my age.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I was going to the bathroom all the time.  It was horrible, on vacation finding bathrooms everywhere we went.  After I started Vesicare I only go to bathroom 1 or 2 times all day long. I have had no side effects at all and feel great. I have been taking it for almost 1 year.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Vesicare was working but the side effect (dry mouth) was severe. I have to stop taking it.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Exacerbated acid reflux and stomach pain but definitely reduced frequency.

VESIcare (solifenacin):VESIcare seems to be helping.  Took Detrol LA for 2 months with some improvement.  Changed to VESIcare for a month and went from going 18 times a day to 10 to 12, and only getting up once most nights.  I am only 36 and still active and the only side effect I have noticed is I have stopped sweating.  Real pain with my job (I'm a firefighter) but just try to think ahead and take measures to cool off as quick as I can.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I have had problems for years, with urine leakage/having to go to the bathroom a lot and not being able to hold it.  Last year, the doctor that I was seeing had suggested that I have surgery to correct the problem.  I would have had to be off work for 6 weeks.  I've been on Vesicare for just over a month and it's a lifesaver.  I started seeing results almost immediately. Now, instead of having to go to the bathroom every few hours (I drive a para-transit bus) and not being able to make it to the bathroom in time, I go maybe 4 times a day.  I would recommend it to anyone that was having problems with overactive bladder.  The coupon, that my pharmacist includes, also helps....thanks!  My husband says thanks to.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Went from having to get up 3 times each night to urinate to only once each night!  Has made for a much more restful nights sleep!  Great medicine.
VESIcare (solifenacin):Took my first pill yesterday evening, couldn't get to sleep at all, and went to the bathroom more than ever all night.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I took one pill at night as directed  by my doctor and the next day I had tightness in the chest and could feel my heart racing. Disappointed that this medication is not for me. Hope there is something that will be able to help  this frustrating problem.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I was back to normal after 2 pills.  No more urgency, accidents, or frequency.  I have got my life back.  I suffered for 3 years before going to the doctor because I was sure I'd have to have surgery or some horrible procedure done.  I wish I had gotten this medicine 3 yrs. ago!
VESIcare (solifenacin):Tried Vesicare with Flomax for about 6 weeks. I saw a little improvement but not enough. Switched to Detrol LA and improved a great deal.
VESIcare (solifenacin):I noticed a difference after the first pill. Things are back to normal now.

VESIcare (solifenacin):I am a male and I was told that mostly women use this type of medicine. I can't say enough good things about Vesicare. My doctor says it's the only medication in the class of drugs that last the whole 24 hours. It especially helps with my urgent feelings.
VESIcare (solifenacin):This worked great but caused bad constipation. I know it was from Vesicare because I have never had constipation before.
Vesicare increased the amount my bladder could hold from 300 cc's to 450 cc's, a significant improvement.
